## NS.getServerSecurityLevel() method

Returns the security level of the target server. A serverâ€™s security level is denoted by a number, typically between 1 and 100 (but it can go above 100).

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
getServerSecurityLevel(host: string): number;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  host | string | Host or IP of target server. |

<b>Returns:</b>

number

Security level of the target server.

## Remarks

RAM cost: 0.1 GB
